Articles.Content: Does Ksp have the programing in for running a a multi core possessor?
Sort of, however it is not multithreaded, which means it can only be process on one thread. The computer typically can run that thread over multiple cores but it really makes no difference.

No, single thread only. IF Unity comes out with support for it next version, and IF the KSP devs are so inclined to re-write for it... then maybe it will. There was prior discussion on this here in the forums, don't know where the thread is.
Afaik it does use multithreading. Sfx, gfx and physics use different threads. But only one for each one.

I'm on a phone and can't find it right now, but about a year ago C7 posted an article explaining this. KSP itself IS multithreaded. The physics is what isn't, and that's what slows the game down most.
The only thing we can hope for is for Unity to get updated. Then it has to implemented.
Yeah, that was my understanding. Technically it's multithreaded, but one thread - the physics - ends up with 95% of the work.

KSP uses many threads (as you would expect) and uses 2 cores heavily, with 3+ giving a small benefit over 2.

DMagic has been collecting CPU benchmark results for ages now

Also scroll down here to the CPU core usage to see some tests I did in ages ago on the same q66600 machine with cores disabled, also other results with different clock speeds.
